name: 彭尉祖
objective: This course provides a comprehensive study of convective heat transfer, focusing on the fundamentals of fluid flow, energy transport, and boundary layer theory. Both forced and natural convection are examined in detail, with emphasis on governing equations, similarity analysis, and engineering correlations. Applications to internal and external flows are highlighted to prepare students for solving real-world thermal problems.
schedule:
Week 1 (9/11): Overview of heat transfer
Week 2 (9/18): Introduction to convective heat transfer 
Week 3 (9/25): Governing equations I: conversation of mass and momentum
Week 4 (10/2): Governing equations II: energy transport
Week 5 (10/9): Boundary layer theory I: velocity boundary layer
Week 6 (10/16): Boundary layer theory II: thermal boundary layer 
Week 7 (10/23): Similarity solutions for laminar boundary layers
Week 8 (10/30): Heat transfer to fully-developed flow
Week 9 (11/6): Midterm exam
Week 10 (11/13): Heat transfer to developing flow
Week 11 (11/20): Natural convection I: vertical surface
Week 12 (11/27): Natural convection II: horizontal surface
Week 13 (12/4): Transition to turbulence
Week 14 (12/11): Turbulent boundary layer flow
Week 15 (12/18): Heat transfer in turbulent boundary layer flow
Week 16 (12/25): No lecture (Constitution Day)
Week 17 (1/1): No lecture (New Year)
Week 16 (1/8): Final exam
materials: Adrian Bejan, “Convection Heat Transfer,” 2nd ed., ISBN 0-471-57972-6. John Wiley & Sons, Inc., New York, United States of America, 1995.
